excerpt: Shows by marine animals, birds & snakes, plus guided tours & feeding sessions in the penguinarium.
detail_description: Selwo Marina is a marine animal park in Benalmadena, offering shows featuring dolphins, birds, and snakes. Visitors can enjoy guided tours and feeding sessions in the penguinarium. The park is home to various plant and animal species from around the world, including penguins, sea lions, exotic birds, crocodiles, piranhas, anacondas, and more.
name: Selwo Marina
address: Parque de la Paloma s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Family-friendly exhibits with a variety of sea creatures (most offer play areas & group packages).
detail_description: Sea Life Benalmádena is a top-notch aquarium situated at the entrance to the Benalmadena Marina, offering an array of family-friendly exhibits showcasing various sea creatures. Visitors can marvel at legendary sharks, the world's largest Japanese spider crab, and green turtles. The interactive aquarium provides touch pools, a walk-through tunnel, and feeding demonstrations for an immersive experience.
name: Sea Life Benalmádena
address: Av. del Puerto Deportivo, s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Park at a Thai temple with more than 1,500 butterflies, plus art & educational information.
detail_description: Mariposario de Benalmádena-Butterfly Park is a captivating attraction that offers an up-close encounter with over 1,500 butterflies of 150 different species. Nestled in the scenic Benalmadena Pueblo, the park features breeding rooms where visitors can witness the enchanting life cycle of these colorful creatures, from caterpillar to chrysalis.
name: Mariposario de Benalmádena-Butterfly Park
address: C. Muerdago, s/n, 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: The 15-minute journey up Mount Calamorro in this modern cable car provides spectacular views.
detail_description: Experience the breathtaking Benalmádena Cablecar for an unforgettable journey to the summit of Mount Calamorro. The modern cable car offers stunning aerial views of Benalmádena and its surroundings, ascending to over 700 meters. From the top, visitors are treated to panoramic vistas of the Costa del Sol, with sights stretching from the Mediterranean Sea to Sierra Nevada and even on clear days, the coast of Africa.
name: Benalmádena Cablecar
address: Explanada del Tivoli, s/n, 29631 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Benalmádena is a town on southern Spain's Costa del Sol, known for its beaches and Tivoli World theme park. The modern Puerto Marina is home to the Sea Life Benalmádena aquarium and moored yachts. In the traditional Andalusian old town lie the Castillo Monumento Colomares, a castle-style monument dedicated to Christopher Columbus and his discovery of America, and the Benalmádena Stupa, a large Buddhist temple.
detail_description: Benalmádena, located on the Costa del Sol in southern Spain, offers a mix of modern attractions and traditional Andalusian charm. The town is divided into two centers: Benalmadena Pueblo, situated on the hillside, and Benalmadena Costa, a luxurious beach resort with a long stretch of beach and a beautiful marina surrounded by unique architecture.
name: Benalmádena
address: Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Spacious urban park featuring an artificial pond, walking paths, playgrounds & dining areas.
detail_description: Parque de la Paloma is a delightful urban oasis that invites visitors to unwind amidst its lush greenery and serene atmosphere. This spacious park features an artificial pond, meandering walking paths, vibrant playgrounds for children, and charming dining areas perfect for a leisurely meal. It stands out as one of the must-visit attractions in the region, alongside other popular spots like Benalmadena Beaches and Tivoli World Park.
name: Parque de la Paloma
address: Av. Federico García Lorca, s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Waterfront plaza boasting posh retailers & restaurants in a relaxed, open-air setting.
detail_description: Puerto Marina Benalmádena Official is a vibrant waterfront plaza featuring upscale shops and dining options in a relaxed, outdoor setting. The area offers diverse nightlife experiences, catering to different crowds with its variety of bars and clubs. This award-winning marina serves as a hub for nautical activities and entertainment, boasting an array of restaurants, bars, shops, and even an aquarium. Its unique architectural style blends Arabic and Andalusian elements, creating a captivating atmosphere for leisurely strolls.
name: Puerto Marina Benalmadena
address: C. La Fragata, A11, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Puerto Marina is a charming harbor located just a short 5-minute walk away, offering stunning sea views from most of its rooms. The area is surrounded by numerous bars, restaurants, and shops, creating a pleasant and cozy atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful waterfront with plenty of dining options and even a shopping center nearby.
name: Puerto Marina
address: 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Waterfront cultural center with exhibits & special events such as concerts & art shows.
detail_description: Castillo de El-Bil-Bil, also known as Bil Bil Castle, is a striking waterfront cultural center located in Benalmadena Costa. This early 20th-century landmark was built by an Englishman named William Leonard Hunt and features a unique architectural style that blends Moorish and Andalusian design elements. The castle hosts various events such as art exhibitions, concerts, and conferences.
name: Castillo de El-Bil-Bil
address: Av. Antonio Machado, 78, 29631 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: This architecturally unique castle-style monument honoring Christopher Columbus offers scenic views.
detail_description: Colomares Castle, located in Benalmadena Pueblo, is a relatively new monument built between 1987 and 1994. Despite its recent construction, the castle exudes an old-world charm and features a unique blend of architectural styles including Mudejar, Gothic, Byzantine, and Romanesque. This makes it the largest monument in the world dedicated to Christopher Columbus. The castle offers breathtaking views as it stands amidst the treetops and white buildings of the skyline.
name: Colomares Castle
address: Finca la Carraca, Ctra. Costa del Sol, s/n, 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Arroyo de la Miel, which translates to "river of honey," is a charming village nestled between the mountains and the coast near Benalmadena. This vibrant pueblo boasts a diverse population of local and international residents, as well as a thriving tourist sector. Visitors can explore various attractions such as a sports complex, bilingual library, and the renowned Tivoli World theme park.
name: Arroyo de la Miel
address: 29631, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Large Buddhist monument to enlightenment containing a meditation hall & an array of sacred objects.
detail_description: The Stupa of Enlightenment in Benalmádena is a significant Buddhist monument symbolizing peace, prosperity, and harmony. Inaugurated in 2003, it is the largest stupa in the Western World and serves as a place for reflection and meditation. Managed by the Asociacion Cultural Karma Kagyu de Benalmadena, this iconic monument offers access to its inner structure, including a meditation hall with serene surroundings overlooking the coastline.
name: Stupa of Enlightenment Benalmádena
address: Av. Retamar, s/n, 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Seaside 2,559-ft. Costa Del Sol peak accessed via cable car or path, with views of Africa & caves.
detail_description: Calamorro is a 2,559-ft. peak located in Costa Del Sol, offering stunning views of the coastline from Malaga city to Fuengirola and beyond. Visitors can reach the summit via a cable car ride on the Teleferico, which starts from Tivoli World. Alternatively, they can opt for a 2-3 hour hike to the top. Once there, they can explore exclusive hiking trails showcasing Mediterranean flora and fauna.
name: Calamorro
address: 29631 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Plaza de España is the bustling heart of the town, where many main streets converge. It's a vibrant hub with plenty of bars and restaurants to enjoy. At its center stands the stunning 1785 fountain of Carlos III, while the adjacent 17th century chapel of Saint Sebastian adds to its charm. This lively square is a focal point for local social gatherings and activities.
name: Pl. de España
address: 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Playa Arroyo de la Miel is a charming beach with a Blue Flag distinction, ensuring cleanliness and excellent services. It's conveniently located near the center and boasts fine sand and pristine waters. The beach features a flowing stream that provides a safe play area for children. Visitors can enjoy various amenities such as sunbathing, inflatable toys, restaurants, bars, and swimming.
name: Arroyo de la Miel Beach
address: 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Popular Mediterranean resort La Carihuela is defined by its summer beach scene, with hutlike outdoor chiringuito bars serving cold beer and classic pescaíto fried fish, alongside upscale Spanish sea-view restaurants. The waterside promenade draws locals and holidaymakers for evening strolls, and rugged headland Punta Gatuna has a quiet lookout spot for sunset views. Flashy modern dance clubs get busy after dark.
detail_description: La Carihuela, a popular Mediterranean resort, is known for its vibrant beach scene and charming outdoor chiringuito bars offering refreshing drinks and traditional pescaíto fried fish. The waterfront promenade attracts both locals and tourists for leisurely evening walks, while Punta Gatuna's rugged headland provides a serene spot to enjoy stunning sunset views. After dark, modern dance clubs come alive with lively entertainment.
name: La Carihuela
address: Churriana, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Just a brief stroll down Calle Felix Solesio will lead you to the serene Plaza de España, a charming little retreat adorned with several authentic bars. Among them, Bar España stands out as one of the finest options for indulging in traditional delights.
name: Plaza de España
address: 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Puerto Deportivo de Benalmádena is a top-notch marina in Spain, offering a residential area that has attracted numerous tourists to the Costa del Sol. The marina boasts an attractive design and convenient berthing port facilities. It has been honored with the Best Marina of the World award twice, ensuring high tourist activity year-round.
name: Puerto Deportivo de Benalmádena
address: Edificio Capitania, Av. Juan Sebastian Elcano, s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Baroque hilltop church complex built between the 16th & 18th centuries with coast views.
detail_description: Iglesia de Santo Domingo de Guzmán is a stunning hilltop church complex with a Baroque-style architecture dating back to the 16th and 18th centuries. The church boasts an ornate interior with intricate stonework, an impressive bell tower, and elaborate gold leaf altarpiece. Visitors can admire detailed frescoes and religious sculptures adorning the walls and ceilings.
name: Iglesia de Santo Domingo de Guzmán | Benalmádena
address: C. Santo Domingo, 16, 29639 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Costasol Cruceros offers a thrilling 2-hour boat circuit in the Mediterranean Sea, suitable for groups of 18. The well-maintained two-floor boat features a bar, music, and clean toilets. While a shade on the top floor would be a nice addition, the overall experience is unforgettable. The professional and friendly staff provide informative explanations in multiple languages.
name: Costasol Cruceros - Paseo Delfines y Ferry Benalmádena/Fuengirola
address: C. La Fragata, 6, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain
